doc.field: has been coming to svalbard for 12 years to study climate change. i am just going to use this to measure the depth of the snowpack and also identify layers of refrozen rainwater within the snow. so, it's gone in fairly easily, it's hit a hard layer. that's one rain event. pushing through that, there's another one. you can hear that hollow sound. that's a layer of refrozen rain.
